official-title.#text:
To amend title 38, United States Code, to clarify the
		  conditions under which certain persons may be treated as adjudicated mentally
		  incompetent for certain purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Conditions for
			 treatment of certain persons as adjudicated mentally incompetent for certain
			 purposes

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, is amended by
			 adding at the end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Chapter 55 of title 38, United States Code

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
of laws and benefits under this
				title, a person who is mentally incapacitated, deemed mentally incompetent, or
				experiencing an extended loss of consciousness shall not be considered
				adjudicated as a mental defective under

without the order or finding of a judge, magistrate, or other
				judicial authority of competent jurisdiction that such person is a danger to
				himself or herself or
				others.
